conduct_jurisdiction.authority: University has authority to safeguard safety, reputation, and well-being of campus community, facilities, and programs
conduct_jurisdiction.legal_relationship: University disciplinary action independent of civil/criminal proceedings

general_provisions: No refunds for students suspended or dismissed for disciplinary reasons
No refund for loss of university contracted services due to disciplinary action
Violations of Kenyan law may result in criminal prosecution
Illegal substance violations may require completion of education/rehabilitation program

sanctions_hierarchy.name: Disciplinary Warning
sanctions_hierarchy.description: Written action for minor student misconduct
sanctions_hierarchy.consequence: Official admonition with warning that further misconduct may result in more severe action

sanctions_hierarchy.name: Probation Level I
sanctions_hierarchy.restrictions: May represent university in activities and hold office during probation
sanctions_hierarchy.warning: Further infractions may result in more stringent restrictions

sanctions_hierarchy.name: Probation Level II
sanctions_hierarchy.description: Most serious sanction short of suspension
restrictions: Cannot represent university in official capacity
Cannot hold office in student organizations
May be restricted from campus events and activities
May be restricted from using university sports facilities
sanctions_hierarchy.status: Remains in good standing, financial aid not affected
sanctions_hierarchy.note: Further violations may lead to suspension or dismissal

sanctions_hierarchy.name: Interim Suspension
sanctions_hierarchy.description: Temporary removal if student poses serious risk
sanctions_hierarchy.process: Can be immediately imposed without warning
sanctions_hierarchy.duration: 14 days from suspension date to appear before hearing officer
sanctions_hierarchy.consequence: Further disciplinary action for unauthorized return

sanctions_hierarchy.name: Suspension
sanctions_hierarchy.requirements: Additional requirements may be established for reinstatement
sanctions_hierarchy.restrictions: Barred from university premises and activities

sanctions_hierarchy.name: Suspension of Group Recognition
sanctions_hierarchy.description: Withdrawal of official recognition for specified period
sanctions_hierarchy.reinstatement: Group members must apply for official lifting

sanctions_hierarchy.name: Dismissal
sanctions_hierarchy.record: Appears on academic history and transcript
sanctions_hierarchy.restrictions: Barred from university activities and premises

sanctions_hierarchy.name: Revocation of Group Recognition
sanctions_hierarchy.description: Permanent cancellation of official university recognition
sanctions_hierarchy.effect: Suspension of group's registration and activities

additional_penalties.restitution_fines: Students/organizations may be obligated to pay damages plus administrative fees for disciplinary proceedings

conduct_violations.violation: Actual or threatened assault, physical assault, or intentional/reckless injury
Sexual assault, rape, attempted rape, sexual harassment, or any other sexual offense
Possession, sale, use, transfer, purchase, or delivery of alcohol, intoxicating substances, or illicit drugs
conduct_violations.note: Except as expressly permitted by law

conduct_violations.violation: Hazing, harassment, bullying, stalking (verbal, written, email, text, or any form)
Causing disturbance under influence of alcohol/intoxicants on premises or at university functions
Offensive or disorderly conduct causing interference, annoyance, or alarm
Littering, defacing university or private property
Interfering with freedom of expression (including invited speakers)
Interference with entry/exit from buildings or free movement
Behavior endangering safety/wellbeing of self/others/property (including stalking)
Disruption of teaching, research, administration, or university activities
Wrongful parking (blocking, abandoning, obstructing disability access)
conduct_violations.sanction: Probation Level 1 + KES 2,000 fine + vehicle clamping
conduct_violations.repeat_offense: Probation Level 2 + parking rights denied for minimum one semester
conduct_violations.note: University may tow vehicle to police station at owner's cost

conduct_violations.violation: Refusal to provide ID or comply with university employee directions
Misuse of university documents/facilities (forgery, altering IDs, peddling falsehoods)
Fraud or false statements in official documents/applications/university sites
Forcible entry into university building or premises
conduct_violations.sanction: Probation Level 2 + payment of repair charges

conduct_violations.violation: Trespass or unauthorized presence in building/premises
Unauthorized possession of firearms, fireworks, dangerous weapons, restricted chemicals, or realistic-looking toy weapons
Gross misconduct (assaulting employee, starting fires, igniting fireworks, unauthorized cooking, incendiary devices, explosives)
False reporting (bomb, emergency, or falsely accusing others)
Tampering with fire or safety equipment
Refusal to evacuate during emergency drills
Damage, destruction, tampering, or defacement of property
Obscenity or lewd or indecent conduct
Social media crimes (cyberbullying, trolling, threats, harassment, hacking, fraud, fake accounts)
Illegal/unauthorized gambling on campus
Violation of residence hall rules
Misuse of communication equipment (electronic/non-electronic devices, notice boards)
Recording voice/image without consent or invading privacy
Unauthorized use of university logo, facilities, premises for personal/commercial purposes
Soliciting/receiving/offering bribes, payoffs, or kickbacks
Disruptive protests/political agitation interfering with rights or safety
Theft or knowingly handling stolen property
Speeding on campus, causing accidents/injury through reckless driving
conduct_violations.sanction: Banned from driving inside university for one semester + Probation Level 2

conduct_violations.violation: Unauthorized use of recording devices (drones, cameras) at university events
Violation of prior disciplinary sanctions
conduct_violations.sanction: Probation Level 2 or Suspension (for serious offenses)

prohibited: Causing disorder, bodily harm, public disturbance
Consumption during university-related travel or functions

illegal_drugs.note: Possession is criminal offense in Kenya

smoking.policy: Strictly prohibited in university buses, buildings, and compounds

alcohol_drug_policy.university_rights: May carry out inspections and order drug/alcohol tests when necessary

verbal: Disparaging remarks about gender or physical appearance
Sexual abuse (direct or disguised as humor)
visual: Displaying sexually graphic materials (posters, magazines, cartoons, graffiti)
other: Promises or threats after negative response to advances

immediate_actions: Ensure safety - go to safe place
Call police (999 or 112), Counselling (748), or GEP Office (210)
Do not shower or bathe (preserves evidence)
Do not throw away or burn clothes
Avoid passing urine if possible (or collect in container)
Do not brush teeth or cut nails
medical_care: Seek assistance at nearest hospital within 72 hours
Get preventive treatment for HIV/AIDS, STIs, pregnancy
Fill Post Rape Care form (original and duplicate copies)
reporting: Report to university security and police

filing_charges.who_can_file: Any member of university community or university department
filing_charges.where_to_file: Dean of Students office or Gender and Equity Protection office
filing_charges.timeline: Within 14 calendar days of infraction (can be extended up to 1 year by DVC Student Life)
filing_charges.investigation_start: Within 10 working days of complaint receipt

hearing_procedures.notification: At least 5 working days notice of hearing
panel_composition: Hearing Officer or designee (chair with casting vote)
student_rights: Friendly advisor present (any university community member not directly involved)
Request extension (within 2 days of notice receipt)
hearing_procedures.hearing_type: Closed to public (except immediate family member and advisor/witness)
hearing_procedures.record: Record of proceedings maintained for 2 years or until appeals exhausted
hearing_procedures.decision_timeline: Verdict within 30 calendar days after hearing

order_of_proceedings: Evidence in support of alleged offender
Witnesses in support of alleged offender

appeal_procedure.timeline: Within 5 working days of hearing outcome to DVCSL
grounds: Proven errors in interpretation/implementation of procedures
New and significant evidence not previously presented
Lack of substantial evidence to support outcome

non_discrimination_policy.policy: Equal education and employment opportunities without unlawful discrimination, harassment, or retaliation
non_discrimination_policy.scope: Between members of university community including students and employees

grievance_filing.against_university_or_employee: University Hearing Officer, HR Manager, DVC Student Life, or Gender and Equity Protection Office

investigation_principles: False accusations subject to same sanctions as offense
non_discrimination_policy.records: Staff in HR Office, students in DVC Student Life office

prohibited: Writing graffiti on university buildings or property
Creating public nuisances (rowdy behavior, fighting, careless driving)
littering_graffiti.enforcement: Contact Security Office, Dean of Students, HR Office, or department manager

posters_media.approval_required: All SA-related posters, flyers, advertisements must be approved by SAC or SPAC
standards: Event approved by Student Life Division officer
posters_media.removal: Two weeks after posting (except election materials)
posters_media.social_media: Must comply with social media policy, reviewed by club patron and Marketing Director

facility_use.priority: Academic classes and activities take priority
facility_use.advance_notice: At least one month for open spaces and sports fields
restrictions: Must not violate Kenyan laws (including noise pollution)
Must not pose undue burden on resources
Fire/fireworks require approval from DVC FinOps and Head of Security

principles: Respect and dignity for student and family
Concern for well-being of campus community

procedures: Affected students may withdraw from semester
May apply for tuition fee exemption
Insurance benefit available (subject to policy terms)
Dean of Students advises beneficiaries on insurance process
Student notifies Dean of Students and school Dean
Dean of Students manages support and counseling referral
Student given reasonable time to make up missed work
School Dean provides guidance on academic activities
